definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: Without it, it was as if he were spiritually stark naked and had nothing to bundle up in.
sentences.chinese: 自己没有文凭，好像精神上赤条条的，没有包裹。

sentences.english: The little boy was having the sunbath on the beach in his birthday suit.
sentences.chinese: 这个小男孩赤条条地躺在沙滩上晒太阳。

sentences.english: You had a gay sex scene in the film, was the process smooth sailing?
sentences.chinese: 第一次赤条条与裸男演性爱戏，过程顺利吗？

sentences.english: The little boy was sunbathing on the beach in his bithday suit.
sentences.chinese: 这个小男孩赤条条地躺在海滩上晒太阳。

sentences.english: We all come into the world without possessions.
sentences.chinese: 我们都是赤条条地来到这个世界的。

sentences.english: The beach in Florida is an ideal place for sunbathing .
sentences.chinese: 这个小男孩赤条条地躺在海滩上晒太阳。

definition: not wearing one thread (idiom); absolutely naked/without a stitch of clothing/in one's birthday suit
to strip naked/to strip nude/(coll.) to find oneself a partner
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
lit. clothes not covering the body (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
